intro: Fagara rhoifolia f. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate fagara, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves that are often aromatic. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. The fruit is a small, round drupe that turns from green to yellow or red when mature.
